abstract: A struggle for control has erupted on the board of Norilsk Nickel, one of Russia’s most valuable mining companies and the world’s largest producer of nickel and platinum group metals, which currently have new uses in fuel cells for electric cars.
snippet: A struggle for control has erupted on the board of Norilsk Nickel, one of Russia’s most valuable mining companies and the world’s largest producer of nickel and platinum group metals, which currently have new uses in fuel cells for electric cars.
lead_paragraph: A struggle for control has erupted on the board of Norilsk Nickel, one of Russia’s most valuable mining companies and the world’s largest producer of nickel and platinum group metals, which currently have new uses in fuel cells for electric cars, The New York Times’s Andrew E. Kramer reported.

headline.main: Feud at Russian Mining Firm Threatens Markets
